Job Title: Manager, Brand Communications (US Sports)

Location: Portland, OR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Advertising, Art/Creative, Marketing

Description:
Purpose & Overall Relevance For The Organisation

Support the development of an integrated, horizontal marketing communication approach for select US Sports product concepts and key sport moments to create demand for the adidas brand.

Key Responsibilities

Create & execute comms plans with consistent and clear objectives / KPIs for reach, resonance and reactions. Support development of communication tools from conception to implementation, ensuring all projects are on brief, on budget and meet brand standards. Assist with management of global and local agencies across projects and activities for the business unit: agency briefing process and development of concepts and creative elements.Collaborate with local markets and global brand comms on the activation of annual category plans.Support consistency across all sport categories to ensure clear adidas US sports takeaways that ladder to the overall strategySupport horizontal planning for brand communication function within BUOversee seasonal sample process in support of photoshoots, partner seeding, key moments on behalf of US SportsSupport precap and recap process in accordance to NAM Activation Planning Process by tracking US Sports projects, collating results, learnings and best practice sharing Maintain, track and manage budget for brand communications function within BU
Key Relationships

US Sports BU Leaders & NCAA Leadership

X-Category Brand Communications Teams

NAM Brand Comms Planning

adidas Local Markets

adidas Finance / Controlling

adidas Procurement

Creative Agencies

External partners and key accounts

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

Ability to influence without authority by building productive relationships with constituents.Good understanding of consumer behavior , brand building, demand creation, digital, and planning.Strong marketing experience (i.e. communications, campaign development and execution, ecommerce, digital).Understanding of an ever-changing marketing landscape and strong experience in project management.Ability to influence and collaborate with internal and external multidisciplinary groups: product marketing, design, advertising, PR, digital, retail, events, consumer engagement, ecom, newsroom etc.Strong written and verbal communication skillsUnderstanding of and passion for the sports industry inclusive of NCAA.

Requisite Education And Experience / Minimum Qualifications

Degree in Marketing, Communications, Retail, Digital or a related field. 3+ years’ industry and / or relevant work experience.

Experience Level (if available): None
